page.title: 01Forest & Moor E of Wheeldale
page.content: This block is mainly rolling heather moorland but the southern half has mainly been planted with conifers so forest makes up about half the block. The east is bounded by the deep gorge of Northdale Scat along which runs the north York moors railway, road access is limited to Wheelelab Road which becomes a dirt track, and a few other tracks used by foresters. There is a small amount of farming (sheep & cattle grazing) and some sheep graze the the moorland edge. The few residents are farmers. Tourists visit the area,but the lack of roads deter larger numbers of drivers. Walking in the area is popular because the scenery is quite interesting and the population is very low. There is a quite well preserved stretch of old Roman road in the NW.
